oai_dc:dc.dc:title: EXPERIMENTAL STUDY ON BORE-INDUCED SWASH INTERACTIONS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chen, Botao
Kikkert, Gustaaf
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: swash interaction
laboratory experiment
dam-break
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The current study reports the results from a new laboratory experimental investigation, carried out to improve understanding and modeling of the internal kinematics of swash interactions, and its role on beach face morphology. Two typical types of swash interactions, wave capture interaction and backwash interaction (Erikson et al., 2005), were observed in detail by conducting large-scale dam-break experiments in a flume with two adjacent reservoirs and a fixed coarse-sand beach. The experiments were designed to enable detailed measurements of swash depths, velocity fields and turbulent quantities at different locations across the swash zone to be obtained.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; posters.32
